intro: Aganope dinghuensis, commonly known as the Dinghu mountain aganope, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and dark green, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Its flowering period occurs in the spring, and it is noted for its ornamental value. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
